org.pipservices.runtime.config

Class MicroserviceConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pipservices.runtime.config.MicroserviceConfig

  • public class MicroserviceConfig
extends Object
    Configuration for the entire microservice. It can be either stored in JSON file on disk, kept in remote configuration registry or hardcoded within test.
    Since:
    2016-06-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergey Seroukhov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MicroserviceConfig()
      Creates an empty instance of the microservice configuration.
      MicroserviceConfig(DynamicMap content)
      Creates instance of the microservice configuration and initializes it with data from dynamic map.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MicroserviceConfig fromTuples(Object... tuples)
      Creates component configuration using hardcoded parameters.
      static MicroserviceConfig fromValue(Object value)
      Creates microservice configuration using free-form objects.
      DynamicMap getRawContent()
      Gets the raw content of the configuration as dynamic map
      List<ComponentConfig> getSection(String category)
      Gets configurations of components for specific section.
      void removeSections(String... categories)
      Removes specified sections from the configuration.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MicroserviceConfig

        public MicroserviceConfig()
        Creates an empty instance of the microservice configuration. It can be filled with data manually or loaded from the file.

      • MicroserviceConfig

        public MicroserviceConfig(DynamicMap content)
        Creates instance of the microservice configuration and initializes it with data from dynamic map.
        Parameters:
        content - map with configuration parameters

    • Method Detail

      • getRawContent

        public DynamicMap getRawContent()
        Gets the raw content of the configuration as dynamic map
        Returns:
        dynamic map with all microservice configuration parameters.

      • getSection

        public List<ComponentConfig> getSection(String category)
        Gets configurations of components for specific section.
        Parameters:
        category - a category that defines a section within microservice configuration
        Returns:
        an array with components configurations

      • removeSections

        public void removeSections(String... categories)
        Removes specified sections from the configuration. This method can be used to suppress certain functionality in the microservice like api services when microservice runs inside Lambda function.
        Parameters:
        categories - a list of categories / section names to be removed.

      • fromValue

        public static MicroserviceConfig fromValue(Object value)
        Creates microservice configuration using free-form objects.
        Parameters:
        value - a free-form object
        Returns:
        constructed microservice configuration

      • fromTuples

        public static MicroserviceConfig fromTuples(Object... tuples)
        Creates component configuration using hardcoded parameters. This method of configuration is usually used during testing. The configuration is created with 'Undefined' category since it's not used to create a component.
        Parameters:
        tuples - configuration parameters as + tuples
        Returns:
        constructed microservice configuration
